VTTCue.summary: The VTTCue interface of the WebVTT API represents a cue that can be added to the text track associated with a particular video (or other media).

remarks.para: A cue defines the text to display in a particular timeslice of a video or audio track, along with display properties such as its size, alignment, and position.

VTTCueLineAlign.summary: The lineAlign property of the interface represents the alignment of this VTT cue.
VTTCueLineAlign.value: A string containing one of the following values:

VTTCueLine.summary: The line property of the interface represents the cue line of this WebVTT cue.
VTTCueLine.value: A number, or "auto" representing the cue line of this WebVTT cue.

VTTCueSnapToLines.summary: The snapToLines property of the interface is a {{jsxref("Boolean")}} indicating if the property is an integer number of lines, or a percentage of the video size.

VTTCueSize.summary: The size property of the interface represents the size of the cue as a percentage of the video size.
VTTCueSize.value: A number representing the size of the cue as a percentage of the video size.

VTTCueVertical.summary: The vertical property of the interface is a string representing the cue's writing direction.
VTTCueVertical.value: A string containing one of the following values:

VTTCueGetCueAsHTML.summary: The getCueAsHTML() method of the interface returns a containing the cue content.

VTTCueText.summary: The text property of the interface represents the text contents of the cue.
VTTCueText.value: A string containing the raw text of the cue.

VTTCueAlign.summary: The align property of the interface represents the alignment of all of the lines of text in the text box.
VTTCueAlign.value: A string containing one of the following values:

VTTCuePosition.summary: The position property of the interface represents the indentation of the cue within the line.
VTTCuePosition.value: A number, or "auto" representing the indentation of the cue within the line.

VTTCuePositionAlign.summary: The positionAlign property of the interface is used to determine what is anchored to.
VTTCuePositionAlign.value: A string containing one of the following values:

VTTCueVTTCue.summary:
The VTTCue() constructor creates and returns a new
object.
VTTCueVTTCue.returns:
A new object representing a cue which will be presented during
the time span given.

VTTCueRegion.summary: The region property of the interface returns and sets the that this cue belongs to.
